file_content.text: The Jedi Council will have much to say about your new recruit, I'm certain.
Forgive me, young Jedi, but I do not have time to give lessons these days.
My only concern is administering to the order's new recruits. If you are here on an unrelated matter, I fear I have no help to offer.
I'm here on business, Master. I found a Flesh Raider who wants to be a Jedi.
Let me explain the situation.
How does one get a candidate into the Jedi Order?
Tell me about your work.
The Jedi seek out young children with sensitivity to the Force. Older candidates are occasionally admitted with the approval of the Jedi Council.
But I don't think you came to discuss hypotheticals. If you know someone whose potential we've overlooked, please be frank with me.
I've got a new student for you.
I'm recruiting someone.
That's not how it works. You don't simply pick someone and hand him over to me.
You may reveal the student to me, and I will consider the matter. If necessary, I may take it up with the Jedi Council.
Can I just send the student to you?
I'd like to bring him in.
I suppose you could. I'd need to meet with him eventually in order to make my assessment.
It seems there's a Flesh Raider strong in the Force. He's requested training.
It's one of the natives.
A Flesh Raider? You're serious?
My understanding is that those creatures are primitive, cruel and bloodthirsty--not ideally prepared for the lifestyle of a Jedi.
This Flesh Raider will murder a child if we refuse to teach him. We don't have much of a choice.
If we don't, someone dies.
A wicked situation. The order is not a prison, nor a place for repentance--it is for the dedicated, the willing.
If we want to change their ways, we have to start somewhere.
That's why we should help.
I am reluctant to accept candidates purely to affect wider change. But I hear what you say, and I would know your thoughts.
All true.
And yet you come to me anyway.
Even assuming this recruit is strong in the Force, do you really think such a dangerous student could be taught?
You should probably just meet him yourself.
Talk to him, okay?
I don't appreciate you being tight-lipped on this matter.
The life of a Jedi is difficult in the best of circumstances. There are those who simply aren't fit to join the order.
Even assuming this recruit is strong in the Force, do you really think your mystery student can be taught?
I believe there's a chance.
Perhaps.
If he stays untrained, he'll go to the dark side.
Without us, he's a danger.
Perhaps you're right.
The Jedi managed to teach me, didn't they?
You've had harder students.
Indeed. I've heard stories.
Very well. Send your recruit to the temple. Give him this medallion, and the watchmen will know to grant him passage.
When he arrives, I will consult with the Jedi Council. We will do what we can.
You're finding your way around the temple, I hope? I know it can be confusing.
Are you certain you should be in the temple?
